poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: You'd lent me your apartment I was looking out the window on New York And put my hands In the pockets of your trenchcoat Which I had no right to do, even if It did look like my daughter's. I found a brown velvet clasp with a loop of ribbon You fastened back your hair with that. There was a singlet of yours on the floor. In the other pocket Was a wrapper from an Opal Fruit. This WAS My daughter's coat. What am I doing here? Wisely then I woke up.
